title: Bi-Weekly Financial Advice/Discussion Thread
selftext:
Discuss banking tips, ask questions and share recommendations on security, investments and other banking products: accounts, credit cards, and insurance.

You can also ask for help if you are facing any financial problems and need legal help.

Also, do check out our friendly neighborhood subs r/IndiaInvestments and r/LegalAdviceIndia.

Want to discuss about financial advice when this thread isn't stickied? Join our [Discord](https://discord.gg/6V29X7f) server. We have a separate channel, #financial-advice, exclusively for this topic.

***Disclaimer:*** *Any advice given by our community members shouldn't be the only source to make your final decision, please contact a fee only SEBI registered advisor if you are in doubt or need a more personal approach to your situation. We are in no way responsible for your loss if such arises in future.*

**Financial Advice Thread is posted every two weeks on Monday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Financial+Advice%2FDiscussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/767j6zz3y8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=381d57898ff1eec2aaf4afa6b9f757ba13a31534
comments:
Hi,

I am 18, and I recently started earning. I am currently investing 10% of my overall income in safe smallcases like All Weather Investing. I also have many future plans when my income increases, but I would love to hear from you all, if there is something I should do or learn early for my future investment journey.

https://preview.redd.it/9bdr2moysp9b1.jpeg?width=995&format=pjpg&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=c26b8739402df9f92a570249d4df7b26ec9f4dc8

Hello, I'm 22(M), pursing MBA and living in an tier-2 city yet my living cost is huge, I know this is due to fooding cost mostly. I want to keep my diet healthy and yet keep my budget low. My monthly pocket money is ₹15k. Need to keep it near it.Help me achieve that.

A few questions:

* Emergency funds - why is there a 3k contribution to emergency fund every month. Is it because you are building it up? Since, at one point, you'll stop contributing in it, that will reduce that 3k allocation
* Mobile - I'm assuming this is more than just mobile. It might include your primary internet, but if not, you can reduce the allocation here. There are plenty of options to reduce that
* Why invest in MF if your expenses > 'income'. First build you emergency fund, and then, once it is built, then start contributing to MFs. Just by optimizing on these two, you should be able to get your outgo lower than income.
* For food, look for tiffin services or something. I'm assuming you are 'eating out' every time. Aside from it being relatively unhealthy, it is definitely a huge expense burden. Tiffin services would be your best option. Even better would be if you can cook yourself. I suspect you won't have the time and/or skill. I can tell you, not only will you eat healthy but your expenses would go down to less than to 20-25%

How do u increase your cibil or experian credit score? And owning how many accounts start affecting the cibil n experian rating?       
(I have 6 acc and an app says it's fair, what would make it good or excellent?)
but *we have no idea of ur food habits
This is huge help. Thanks buddy.
